text: Idea: Something I've run into a couple times in the past weeks is clients and editors being hesitant to work with global modules in the design manager. Would be really cool to have a user flow similar to the logo module, where users at the page level can edit the content optionally at the page level, or also could update the content in the page and then click a "update all instances" or similar button.
That's definitely something we're exploring right now :+1:
it would be good if it would be possible to set a size limit for images. People might upload HUGE files and crash the Design Manager and cause weird bugs.

I second that. Haven't had problems with it crashing the design manager, but had problems with marketing people adding huge images such that pages would take 30 seconds to load.

If instead of a size limit, would be even nicer if there was an image optimizer to reduce sizes automatically.
i read that HubSpot creates a srcset so image optimization is done in a way already i guessâ€¦

but yeah, Image optimization in addition would be great.  I also had a Marketing Manager upload a 32 MB Background Image this week. Fortunately the file was not corrupted, therefore the file Manager was not crashing!
